name: 2kings
text: A comment left by 2kings was marked as spam and excluded. 2kings: What a douche. (reported by mortshire, delete, camino)

name: ambala
text: I like Mr. Bear's Vanna White-esque sweeping arm gesture.

name: woodenteeth
text:
For whatever reason I skimmed this post and read "Vanilla Ice-esque" sweeping arm gesture, and immediately was scanning my mind for the Ice Ice Baby film clip and remembered a couple of similar gestures.

My memory is a very well-maintained garbage tip apparently.

name: billyamericana
text: Never have seen the "executioner's axe" 'stache in real life. It'd be a treat.

name: em2
text: What's interesting is that it's a regression of the 'stache back to how it was pre-"Sex Funeral."

name: biff
text:
I have seen it in real life. The guy who was sporting it was probably in his mid 50s.

It was so enormous, so spectacular, so phenomenal, that I immediately went home and shaved my wimpy little mustache right off.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Awww. A true executioner.

name: mortshire
text: A comment left by mortshire was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, MrMojoRisin, Overmedicated)

name: craigola
text: I too need to borrow some money.

name: gumfish
text: This is the best strip ever. At least the best of the early ones.

name: straw
text: I have a hard time disagreeing with this. Lyle's line is just priceless. Lyle's line IS Achewood! :kicks pennyarcade into a well:

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Deusoma, dizneedave, Aaron_Haynes, achilleselbow, usversusthem)

name: straw
text: Ok, well I don't see why you get lamed and I don't but ok.  Completmentary chubby for you, Mr. Riot (because I assume that your name is Rowboat Riot).

name: ford
text: Stupid dick jokes > Stupid "It's hard raising a teenager" jokes

name: ford
text: I don't wanna come flying to Penny Arcade's defense, but comparing them unfavorably to newspaper pap is a little low.

name: ford
text: I also wanted to note that i did not lame you.

name: saint
text: classy...asking an otter toddler for money as you guest on a show in a cardboard box.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Later Lyle gets sneakier, using "Cunty the Sardine" to extort money from Philippe. As long as the little Otter is having fun, so what? Ray will probably drop some cash the kids way soon. It is Achewoodomics in action.

name: aelindil
text:
And somehow Achewoodomics still works better than Reaganomics.

hell yes i went there

name: nigelchaos
text:
Take *THAT* "morning in America!"

also, chubby.

name: nonorganon
text: The time before Mr Bear was established as old and worldly is really awkward.

name: alejandroadam
text: not really.

name: twohundredninety
text: Yeah. In retrospect, at least.

name: direhaggis
text: The fake TV is an element I miss in the later strips.

name: tinhand
text: I agree that it seems weird looking at earlier strips written before the characters were really given personalities. Less satisfying...it seems like a whole different comic.

name: shoinan
text:
All these earlier strips are very Phillipe-central. As fantastic a character as he is, the introduction of Ray and Roast Beef are fundamental to Achewood's success.

However little gems of character development appear, and we learn a little more about Lyle here, and his atypical relationship with Phillipe.

name: radishes
text: I absolutely adore this one. As best I can tell, the reason is the word "Listen" followed by a comma in the third panel.

name: synnah
text: That's pretty much the reason I gave it a 5, too. My favourite early strip.

name: hereward
text: True for the grammar analysis but also the line, as well as being characterful, breaks out of the context and anything you were expecting. This is actually one thing Achewood often doesn't do nowadays.

name: wonelove
text: Lyle is pausing after the word 'listen' to add a dramatic element to his situation.

name: quarantine
text: Lyle is basically the only character who hasn't changed.

name: cailetshadow
text: It's a lot like real TV, actually...

name: qeramah
text: Not much different than PBS, really.

name: weekendofsound
text: Classic Lyle.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: dress shirt with sleeves ripped off, indeed classic Lyle

name: cousinted
text: Fun fact: Lyle wasn't seen for a week after this strip ran.

name: laserblade
text: This is the first one that really clicks with me.

name: i_love_kate
text: One of the few instances that I can claim that Achewood vocab or phraseology has entered my everyday use. Whenever I'm introduced to someone in what I consider an overtly important way, my first instinct is always to rest my elbow on something and say "Listen, I need to borrow some money."

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i, too, do things like this.

a chubby for you.

name: snowman
text: The last panel.

name: coco
text: If it had been the Mr. Bear Play, Lyle would have been breaking the fourth wall in the worst way.

name: chachibenji
text:
Early on Achewood seemed to be about a bunch of stuffed animals doing anything to keep boredom away.
This is one of my early favorites just because Lyle epitomizes the worst thing that can happen when watching TV.

name: tekende
text:
This is not the worst thing that can happen when watching TV.

The worst thing that can happen when watching TV is clearly displayed in The Ring.

name: chachibenji
text:
If a stuffed tiger hit me up for money I would be buggin on a level harder than that of some chick coming out of a TV to get me.
D:

name: aristagoras
text: This may be my favorite Achewood strip that doesn't feature Lie Bot.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ... for your health!

name: alexlike
text: A modern day "Mr Bear Show" would be a gem of tele-visual entertainment at a time filled mostly with rubbish reality TV and sketch shows.

name: johnnyrocker
text: I love this one. So good.

name: sparhawk
text: The question is; is Lyle talking to Phillipe at home or Connie in the studio? If it's the former we may be able to get such as a discussion of the insidious influence of commercial media and how it's trying to get all our money hey no don't take my money I need that money for me going.

name: wonglers
text: Lyle is really not very different from the people on real tv.

name: tekende
text: This is Lyle's version of PBS's fundraiser.

name: cobra_lionfist
text: Lyle is the best.

name: generalfunk
text: as do i

name: carlyle
text: This strip is actually really adorable until panel three.

name: shatneresque
text: Oh my god Achewood started when I was nine people what the hell am I doing here what the hell I was NINE.

name: nice-on-water
text: WHAT IN THE HELL I WAS 13 WHAT IN THE HELLLLL.

name: nice-on-water
text: Or 12, whatever.

name: nice-on-water
text: This might be the earliest comic I ever gave a 5.

name: aperson
text: [B]POOPS

name: teezee
text: Alt text:
